intro: Bustelma, commonly known as the common bustelma, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the carrot family. Bustelma species are often found in moist, temperate regions and are known for their medicinal properties. They have been used traditionally in herbal remedies for their purported health benefits.
